main_definition: Feet are the lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, typically used to refer to the two main body parts in humans that provide support, balance, and movement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used metaphorically or idiomatically to signify a person's arrival or presence
meanings_and_examples.example: He finally came into the room; his feet were on the floor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Representing steps, strides or distance traveled
meanings_and_examples.example: She took ten thousand feet of stairs to reach her apartment on the 10th floor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in expressions like 'got your foot in the door' to indicate starting something new, often with small initial steps
meanings_and_examples.example: His first job was at a local grocery store; it got his foot in the door of the retail industry.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in expressions like 'have one's feet on the ground' to imply practicality or pragmatism
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite her ambitious dreams, she always had her feet firmly planted on the ground.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in expressions like 'taking it one step at a time' to mean making progress gradually
meanings_and_examples.example: After his divorce, he was taking it one step at a time to rebuild his life and move forward.
